channel.title: Quit!
channel.description:
Ever quit a job? Ever redefined yourself within one? Ever started something and won big ... or failed? QUIT! is a call-in show helping people sort out their lives, reevaluate their options, kick their crummy jobs, and start something awesome.
Call in live at 512-518-5714 or leave a voicemail at 512-222-8141. Hosted by Dan Benjamin.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Quit!
channel.itunes:author: 5by5
channel.itunes:summary:
Ever quit a job? Ever redefined yourself within one? Ever started something and won big ... or failed? QUIT! is a call-in show helping people sort out their lives, reevaluate their options, kick their crummy jobs, and start something awesome.
Call in live at 512-518-5714 or leave a voicemail at 512-222-8141. Hosted by Dan Benjamin.

item.title: Quit! 29: The Burden of Being Number One
item.author: Dan Benjamin
item.description: Dan and Haddie are joined in the studio by the host of ScamSchool.tv and NSFWshow, Brian Brushwood, and, the founder of Amplifier and host of the upcoming 5by5 show The Capital, Joel Bush. They discuss the benefits of competition, Paul Thomas Anderson's film, There Will Be Blood (2007), Steve Jobs' response to Android, the competition between Coca-Cola and Pepsi, the pseudo-rivalry that exists between podcasters, strategies utilized by rivals to crush competitors, an article about a failing startup, and later they take some calls.
item.content:encoded:
Dan and Haddie are joined in the studio by the host of ScamSchool.tv and NSFWshow, Brian Brushwood, and, the founder of Amplifier and host of the upcoming 5by5 show The Capital, Joel Bush. They discuss the benefits of competition, Paul Thomas Anderson's film, There Will Be Blood (2007), Steve Jobs' response to Android, the competition between Coca-Cola and Pepsi, the pseudo-rivalry that exists between podcasters, strategies utilized by rivals to crush competitors, an article about a failing startup, and later they take some calls.

There Will Be Blood (2007) - IMDb

A story of family, religion, hatred, oil and madness, focusing on a turn-of-the-century prospector in the early days of the business.

My Startup has 30 Days to Live

Failure is losing the will to fight | Francis Pedraza

A Steve Jobs Moment That Mattered: Macworld, August 1997 - Forbes

“We have to let go of this notion that for Apple to win, Microsoft has to lose,” Jobs said. “We have to embrace a notion that for Apple to win, Apple has to do a really good job. And if others are going to help us, that’s great because we need all the help we can get. And if we screw it and we don’t do a good job, it’s not somebody’s else’s fault. It’s our fault. ”

item.title: Quit! 28: XOXO, A Love Story
item.author: Dan Benjamin
item.description: Dan and Haddie talk to Andy Baio and Andy McMillan about the 2013 XOXO conference September 19th-22nd in Portland, OR, and discuss broader issues including the courage it takes to produce an independent event, the risks and rewards of collaborating with like-minded people, dealing with the fear of success, and more.

item.title: Quit! 25: Hang Up, I Don't Care
item.author: Dan Benjamin
item.description: Dan and Haddie discuss 26-year old CEO David Karp's use of profanity at the end of his release about Yahoo's recent acquisition of Tumblr. Later they take calls and talk about the various issues that come up when doing a Kickstarter, give advice about transitioning from full time student and worker to full time entrepreneur, and more.
item.content:encoded:
Dan and Haddie discuss 26-year old CEO David Karp's use of profanity at the end of his release about Yahoo's recent acquisition of Tumblr. Later they take calls and talk about the various issues that come up when doing a Kickstarter, give advice about transitioning from full time student and worker to full time entrepreneur, and more.

Links for this episode:

Tumblr Staff - News!

Original Transcript: "Everyone, I’m elated to tell you that Tumblr will be joining Yahoo.

Before touching on how awesome this is, let me try to allay any concerns: We’re not turning purple. Our headquarters isn’t moving. Our team isn’t changing. Our roadmap isn’t changing. And our mission – to empower creators to make their best work and get it in front of the audience they deserve – certainly isn’t changing.

So what’s new? Simply, Tumblr gets better faster. The work ahead of us remains the same – and we still have a long way to go! – but with more resources to draw from.

Yahoo is the original Internet company, and Marissa and her team share our dream to make the Internet the ultimate creative canvas. I couldn’t be more excited to have her help. We also share a vision for Tumblr’s business that doesn’t compromise the community and product we love. Plus both our logos end with punctuation!

As always, everything that Tumblr is, we owe to this unbelievable community. We won’t let you down.

Fuck yeah, David"

Marissa's Tumblr • I’m delighted to announce that we’ve reached an...

"I’m delighted to announce that we’ve reached an agreement to acquire Tumblr! We promise not to screw it up. "

If People Were Really Honest in Job Interviews - CollegeHumor Article

Mutator: Mute Your iPhone...With a Twist. by Ron Adair — Kickstarter

Mutator: Mute Your iPhone...With a Twist.

This Is Water - David Foster Wallace

In 2005, author David Foster Wallace was asked to give the commencement address to the 2005 graduating class of Kenyon College. However, the resulting speech didn't become widely known until 3 years later, after his tragic death. It is, without a doubt, some of the best life advice we've ever come across, and perhaps the most simple and elegant explanation of the real value of education.

CAPSULE™ Minimalist™ - A Slim Leather Wallet Made for Cash

Sponsored by Shutterstock (use code DANSENTME5 for 30% off).

item.title: Quit! 24: Scott Johnson
item.author: Dan Benjamin
item.description: Dan interviews Scott Johnson, founder of FrogPants Studios, a hub of nerd and geek media including comics, web art, illustration, podcasts, and more. Scott hosts and produces 9 shows, both daily and weekly, which span a range of topics including apps, comics, early TV pilots, video games, and more. Scott also produces the webcomic My Extra Life. Dan and Scott address issues of making it on one's own terms, seeking out a creative community, spreading the creative spark across different mediums, getting help to steer business, and more.

item.title: Quit! 23: That's What The Money's For
item.author: Dan Benjamin
item.description: Dan discusses the pros and cons of working remotely and, later, takes calls and talks to Robert Sha, the creator of the Capsule minimalist wallet, Josh Centers, the new managing editor for TidBits, and more.
item.content:encoded:
Dan discusses the pros and cons of working remotely and, later, takes calls and talks to Robert Sha, the creator of the Capsule minimalist wallet, Josh Centers, the new managing editor for TidBits, and more.

Links for this episode:

How to Set up your Home Office for Maximum Productivity

Have you ever walked into your home office for a specific task and instead wound up looking through 3 piles of junk mail, and an enormous mound of paperwork on your desk? With more and more home owners taking to the internet and family members of all ages are becoming more computer savvy, the home office has lost its productive edge. If you want to reclaim back your home office and find ways to maximize your productivity look at these helpful tips.

The 6 Best Tips for Being Super Productive While Working Remotely

Getting things done from a home office isn’t a sure thing. You’ll be faced with a different set of challenges, topped by a never-ending line of distractions that are probably more fun than your job. The good news is that you can stay on top of your tasks with a little know-how and a little practice. These tips will help you get started with a productive home office.

Fed Ex Stolen Idea - YouTube

Capsule Minimalist Wallet | Uncrate

Crafted from high quality leather, the Capsule offers an integrated CashStrap to hold bills, a fast access front pocket for your ID and most frequently used cards, and a secure interior pocket for other cards. Overall, it can comfortably carry six cards — as well as several bills — without adding a huge bulge to your pocket.

CAPSULE™

Bernard Madoff - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Bernard Lawrence "Bernie" Madoff (pron.: /?me?d?f/

TidBITS: Apple news for the rest of us

5by5 Jackal T-Shirt (WWDC Edition) – 5by5 Store

Sponsored by Gazelle and Shutterstock (use code DANSENTME5 for 30% off)

item.title: Quit! 22: Depressed in the Midwest
item.author: Dan Benjamin
item.description: Dan is joined by Associate Producer Danielle Moser to discuss dressing up for work as it relates to interviews, productivity, and how it can affect the way you think about yourself and your outlook. They also address the problem of having CEOs dress down during keynote addresses and, later, Dan takes calls and discusses job-seeking, dealing with a bad boss, whether or not to work while going back to school, using a cool idea as the basis for a Kickstarter, and more.

item.title: Quit! 21: Quit & Analyze
item.author: Dan Benjamin
item.description: Dan is joined by a familiar guest, Marco Arment, to take calls and discuss Marco's very recent sale of Instapaper. They delve deeper and discuss when to hire, outsourcing, feeling burnt out, when to sell, and being selective about which company gets to buy what you've built. They take some listener calls and answer questions about job-seeking in a new town, how to come up with the next great idea, the reinvention of the corporate stooge, what to consider when you're desperate for freelance work, and what to do when you get let go from your job.

item.title: Quit! 18: The Problem Is Always You
item.author: Dan Benjamin
item.description: Dan takes calls and responds to listener feedback. Topics include living in a basement, staying in school, quitting a good job you hate to mow lawns, what to do when your family moves and you want to finish school, getting pushed out of your own business and taking a corporate stooge job, quilting as a business, and more.

item.title: Quit! 15: Got Your Sea Legs

item.content:encoded:

Links for this episode:

Jobs to Fill, Employers Wait for Perfection - NYTimes.com

The number of job openings has increased to levels not seen since the height of the financial crisis, but vacancies are staying unfilled much longer than they used to — an average of 23 business days today compared to a low of 15 in mid-2009, according to a new measure of Labor Department data by the economists Steven J. Davis, Jason Faberman and John Haltiwanger.Some have attributed the more extended process to a mismatch between the requirements of the 4 million jobs available and the skills held by many of the 12 million unemployed. That’s probably true in a few high-skilled fields, like nursing or biotech, but for a large majority of positions where candidates are plentiful, the bigger problem seems to be a sort of hiring paralysis.

QUIT! on 5by5

Sponsored by Squarespace (use code STOOGE3 for 10% off).

item.title: Quit! 14: Don't Run A Sh*tty Company
item.author: Dan Benjamin
item.description:
Dan is joined by David Heinemeier Hansson, Shlok Vaidya, Producer Haddie Cooke to discuss telecommuting vs. being in the office.
Note: This episode contains some strong language.
item.content:encoded:
Dan is joined by David Heinemeier Hansson, Shlok Vaidya, Producer Haddie Cooke to discuss telecommuting vs. being in the office.

Note: This episode contains some strong language.

Links for this episode:

Marissa Mayer Is Wrong: Working From Home Can Make You More Productive - Derek Thompson - The Atlantic

Here's the Internal Yahoo No-Work-From-Home Memo - Kara Swisher - News - AllThingsD

Get Off of Your Cloud - NYTimes.com

Many women were appalled at the Yahoo news, noting that Mayer, with her penthouse atop the San Francisco Four Seasons, her Oscar de la Rentas and her $117 million five-year contract, seems oblivious to the fact that for many of her less-privileged sisters with young children, telecommuting is a lifeline to a manageable life.

If Marissa Mayer Were A Man — I.M.H.O. — Medium

Marissa Mayer does not have an easy job. She has been charged with turning around a company that has been in flux for some time. Everyone knows that in order to shrink overhead, you need to get rid of dead weight

Get Off of Your Cloud - NYTimes.com

Twitter / richardbranson: Perplexed by Yahoo! stopping ...

Give people the freedom of where to work - Richard's Blog - Virgin.com

If you provide the right technology to keep in touch, maintain regular communication and get the right balance between remote and office working, people will be motivated to work responsibly, quickly and with high quality.

Internet Evolution - Executive Clan Editor's Blog - Yahoo's Telework Decision Could Be Marissa Mayer's Waterloo

REMOTE: Office Not Required. The new book by 37signals. Coming fall 2013. by Jason Fried of 37signals

David Heinemeier Hansson

DHH (dhh) on Twitter

REMOTE: The new book from 37signals

Remote: Office Not Required: Jason Fried, David Heinemeier Hansson: 9780804137508: Amazon.com: Books

item.content:encoded:

Netflix open sources tool to clean up your AWS cloud — Cloud Computing News

Netflix open sourced the code to Janitor Monkey, a tool it uses to automate the deletion of unused Amazon Web Services resources. It’s easy to spin up cloud compute instances, but not so easy to shut them down as they fall into disuse.

Facebook Mobile User Counts Revealed: 192M Android, 147M iPhone, 48M iPad, 56M Messenger | TechCrunch

As of September 2011, Facebook for Android has 66 million MAU and Facebook for iPhone had 91 million MAU. In December 2011 right before Facebook stopped openly publishing stats, Android surpassed the iOS app. By just 11 months later in November 2012, Android had grown to 192.8 million MAU while iPhone only had 147.2 million MAU.

Sponsored by Squarespace (use code STOOGE1 for 10% off).
